de.uni.bamberg.wiai.minf.forflow.datagenerator.controller.io
Class PhysicalDummyFile

java.lang.Object
  de.uni.bamberg.wiai.minf.forflow.datagenerator.controller.io.PhysicalDummyFile

public class PhysicalDummyFile
extends java.lang.Object

Here is the physical file created we use as a dummy for each artefact generated when it is of artefact type document and has all constraints set to create a file. The constraints are defined in the class DummyFile. This class holds the date used in here.

There are two major methods. One to create a default dummy file and one to create a dummy file with custom content.

Default dummy file
This kind of file has no additional information. It only holds a default content within and gives some rough information about the creation process.

Custom dummy file
With a custom file it is possible to put more helpful information into it. It gives information about what document type was created and represents it, respectively. The complete generated artefact data is put into it and mirrors these informations. The same informations are found in the XML collection data set.

Since:
May/18/09
Version:
0.1
Author:
Michael Munz

Method Detail

createDummyFile

public boolean createDummyFile(java.net.URI file)
creates a physical dummy file at the given path. The parameter file has to hold the path and the file name all in one.

Default dummy file
The file created has the given name at the given folder. And additionally with the given file format. The method has been creating a default file. That means the file holds default content.

Parameters:
file - a dummy file with file name and optional a file format.
Returns:
true if successfully created

createDummyFile

public boolean createDummyFile(java.lang.String file)
creates a physical dummy file at the given path. The parameter file has to hold the path and the file name all in one.

Default dummy file

createDummyFile

public boolean createDummyFile(java.lang.String file,
                               GeneratedArtefact generatedArtefact)
creates a physical dummy file at the given path. The parameter file has to hold the path and the file name all in one.

Extended dummy file
With this method it is possible to create extended dummy files. Unlike the default dummy files these have no default context, but the content of the generated artefact. That is, it tells something about the file the id and the generated facets.

Parameters:
file - the dummy file with file name and optionally with file format
generatedArtefact - the content of the dummy file has the content of the generated test data.
Returns:
true if the dummy file was created with success.
